Description: Funerary papyrus of Soter Pakerer containing Second Book of Breathing (abridged version) written in hieratic script recto and verso.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, Thebes. Found with P. BM EA 10283 on the mummy inside coffin BM EA 6705 in the collective tomb of the archon Soter (see Herbin 2008, 108).
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Herbin, F.-R., Books of Breathing and Related Texts (Catalogue of the Books of the Dead and Other Related Texts in the British Museum IV), London, 2008, pp. 108-109, pls. 74-75.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (229)
Herbin 2008 / Books of Breathing and Related Texts (pp.108-109, pls.74-75)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57802) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57802)
Vleeming 2015 / Demotic graffiti and other short texts gathered from many publications (no.1997, p.347)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured Black ink Backed: white paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Window mount Binding: leather (deteriorated) Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: good
